sizeAndTypeCode.description: 4 digit alphanum code for container size and type, according to ISO 6346
sizeAndTypeCode.title: size and type code

ContentLocation.description: The image file as a BLOB. Possibly not in the same namespace as the Image individual.
ContentLocation.title: Content location

items.description: Planned journey (the object) may be a path, a planned journey (in the strict sense) or a forecast journey (an updated planned journey)
items.title: realizesPlannedJourneyOrPath

hasBICCcode.description: BIC code according to ISO 6346 (4 letters, 6 numeric digits and 1 check digit)
hasBICCcode.title: has BIC code

hasILUcode.description: ILU code (under EN 13044 series) is the standardized identification (owner, number, check digit) for intermodal loading units in Europe. The ILU code is designed for non-ISO containers, swap bodies, semi-trailers in intra-European combined transport.
hasILUcode.title: has ILU code

Interval.description: W3C Time interval, possibly open-ended or degenerate (start = end)

items.description: Note: it may be that the same path or planned journey has multiple schedules (variants), not further characterized here, so we did not make this property functional.
items.title: has journey schedule

JourneySchedule.description: Since journey structures are meant to be shared, their instances should not be modified once used. New instances should be minted for every change.

items.description: May have multiple values (e.g. planned, revised, forecast, actual...), hence NOT a functional property
items.title: has departure time

JourneySchedule.title: Journey schedule

JourneySection.description: Journey sections are chained by properties nextSection and previousSection.

hasRU.description: RU responsible for the journey section. The Lead RU (responsible for the train run also for the commercial aspects) is defined at train run level.
hasRU.title: has RU

JourneySection.title: Journey section

hasFullText.description: typically, the full XML or JSON snippet (including comments, if any)
hasFullText.title: has full text

OTN.description: Operational Train Number. A train may bear different numbers along its course.
OTN.title: OTN

OperationalEntity.description: Abstract class for all things related to the process of operating a freight train
OperationalEntity.title: Operational entity

OperationalInstant.description: An instant related to some operational event (planned / forecast / observed / ...).
OperationalInstant.title: Operational instant

OperationalInterval.description: Time interval, as used in the context of operations. Can play various roles (actual, planned, forecast...). Implementer can choose to coerce it to proper intervals (beginning and end time are then distinct individuals with distinct dateTime values).
OperationalInterval.title: Operational interval

OperationalLocation.description: TAF TSI ontology: identifies a Location using a LocationIdent
OperationalLocation.title: Operational location

hasTrain.description: refers to the train (rolling stock, supplies, loads) that participates in the operational process.
hasTrain.title: has train

OperationalState.description: Note: other states may concern yards, depots, stations... to be discussed.
OperationalState.title: Operational state

issuedAt.description: Timestamp when the forecast value (most common case) or any other time value was generated or last updated
issuedAt.title: issued at

OperationsStakeholder.description: Any registered organisation that is involved in the train run (operators, carriers, consignors and consignees, wagon owners...)

items.description: property listing the possible roles, not those actually played on a particular train run
items.title: plays operational role

OperationsStakeholder.title: Operations stakeholder

items.description: range = rdfs:Literal (not an OWL class) = any number or string. Note: org:identifier is a simplistic way to identify companies; the identifier may be context-specific so they are no longer direct properties is more refined ontologies.
items.title: identifier

PlannedJourney.description: The planned journey may share the same JourneySchedule as the path, or deviate from it (e.g. deviations related to temporary speed restrictions, added or canceled stops). It may be updated after the train departure (in which case it gives rise to a forecast schedule, of a different class).
PlannedJourney.title: Planned journey

Role.description: Note: aligning with DOLCE, roles are defined as individuals such as "freight role" (instance of Load role), with no properties attached.

StaticSection.description: Journey sections "at rest" (but possibly implying shunting movements inside an operational location). May host maintenance or customes operations.
StaticSection.title: Static section

TafMessage.description: Message compliant with TAF TSI XSD
TafMessage.title: TAF message

Track.description: Track in the operational sense, i.e. a stretch of track, usually continuous, that is individuated in operating (driving, shunting) instructions.

items.description: Designation: to be discussed. Probably not unique. Can have short or long forms (e.g. "Track 5" in the context of some yard; "Alnabru yard track 5" in a larger context).
items.title: has designation

Track.title: Track

TractionProvisionRole.description: played by one or more locomotives on a train run
TractionProvisionRole.title: Traction provision role

Train.description: For want of a better class name: denotes the rolling stock (locos, wagons...) AND their supplies (possibly depleted) AND their (variable) loads, considered as a whole, i.e. whatever is moved somewhere between origin and destination in a Train run.
Train.title: Train

items.description: not a functional property, as it can be expressed w.r.t. the planned journey or the executed journey (if available). User feedback welcome.
items.title: has journey

hasMassInTons.description: provisional. To be expanded, using SSN and QUDT.
hasMassInTons.title: has mass in tons

TrainRun.description: Denotes a train run (operated on a particular date), equivalent to "Train" in TAF TSI, not a "timetable entry". It is a process and may have parts that are sub-processes.

items.description: not a functional property, as it can be expressed w.r.t. the planned journey or the executed journey (if available). User feedback welcome.
items.title: has journey

items.description: The same train run can have different Operational Train Numbers in its course, depending on the operator or network over which it is run.
items.title: has OTN

trainLeadRU.description: Points to the "lead RU" for the entire train
trainLeadRU.title: train lead RU

TrainRun.title: Train run

TrainRunState.description: Situation (State) of a train run. Several subclasses define the train run state from several points of view.
TrainRunState.title: Train run state

TrainService.description: e.g. rolling stock maintenance or customs checks
TrainService.title: Train servicing

TrainServicingState.description: Train servicing process, e.g. maintenance, brake inspection...
TrainServicingState.title: Train servicing state

TrainState.description: Characterizes the state of the Train (as a physical asset), e.g. speed, mass, GPS coordinates of some particular point of the train, etc.
TrainState.title: Train state

items.description: following the data requirements, this property qualifies the message. However this may not be optimal, since Operational States "know" about the objects concerned, via dul:hasSetting or dul:hasParticipant.
items.title: has reference object

UnregulatedTrain.description: Unregulated train run. " Unregulated train" might be the correct expression in EN-speaking areas (check). At SNCF, was called " marche indeterminee (abbr. MI)", which is more to the point as " marche" evokes journey execution rather than train.
UnregulatedTrain.title: Unregulated train run

VersionedDescription.description: A description (e.g. of a schedule, or other operational specs such as orders issued to drivers) that can be revised, and is effective (= applicable) from a certain datetime. The versions are chained as a simple list (nop forks, no loops).

items.description: like other time properties, it is not made functional, to allow multiple time representations (time zones).
items.title: created at

items.description: Value can be computed by looking up updates and their "effective from" datetimes, supposing the newer versions invalidate earlier ones at the time they become effective. The ontology does not go that far (it would be a matter of SWRL rules).
items.title: effective until

previousDescriptionVersion.description: A transitive property linking a new description to the (sole) previous one it revises. "Supersedes" would be a ternary relation, the value of which could be deducted from the "effective from" datetimes, and the datetime of the query: not conceptualized in this ontology.
previousDescriptionVersion.title: previous description version

VersionedDescription.title: Versioned description

uicWagonNumber.description: may it vary in a wagon's lifetime? if not, consider moving to rolling stock ontology.
uicWagonNumber.title: uic wagon number

_Thing.description: Base object that all classes inherit from

uri.description: The URI identifier for this instance

_Thing.title: _Thing
